subject: History
goals: Understand the key events and figures that shaped the beginning of the 20th century, focusing on World War I origins.
milestones: Identify and describe at least three major causes of World War I and explain the roles of significant countries involved.

learning_tasks.task: Read an overview of the prelude to World War I, focusing on the geopolitical landscape of Europe in the early 1900s.
Watch a documentary or video summary explaining the alliances system before World War I.
Create a timeline of major events leading up to the outbreak of World War I.

practice_tasks.task: Write a brief essay on how the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand led to the war.
Quiz yourself using online flashcards about key terms and figures from the period.

resources: 1. 'World War I: The Definitive Visual History' by DK; 2. BBC Documentary: '1914-1918: The Great War'; 3. Khan Academy World War I videos.
